Summary: The hotel is modern and clean with free internet. It is located a bit out of the way from central Beijing, but near a large shopping center with many dining options.

The Ascott Beijing offers spacious apartments with fully equipped kitchens and laundry facilities, providing a comfortable and convenient stay. It features amenities such as a pool, gym, on-site restaurants, and a convenience store.

The Autumn Garden Hotel is located in a hutong (maze of alleyways), offering a feel for old China and local living. It is a short walk to Tiananmen Square and subway stations, with trishaw service available to the main road.

The Bamboo Garden Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a peaceful environment with courtyards and gardens, away from the main tourist areas. It features traditionally decorated rooms with modern amenities like computers and flat-screen TVs, and is within walking distance of the subway, local restaurants, and attractions.

Century Towers Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, including a refrigerator, microwave, and washer/dryer, and is located across the street from a large supermarket. The hotel also has a workout room in the basement.

The Dong Fang Hotel is a large hotel that caters to groups, with clean rooms and helpful staff, though some found the staff unfriendly. It has a coffee shop, a bar, and is within walking distance of Tiananmen Square, though some found the location a bit far from sights and taxi drivers unfamiliar with it.

The Far East Hotel/Hostel is located in a hutong, offering a glimpse into traditional Beijing life, with restaurants and shops nearby. It is within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and other main sights and has a tour booking service.

The Friendship Hotel is a large complex with multiple buildings connected by underground walkways, offering various restaurants, shops, and amenities like a pool and fitness center. It is located a bit outside the city core, near universities, with a new subway line opening nearby for easier access to the city.
The Guangming Hotel is near the US and Japanese embassies and has a food street adjacent to it. Rooms are well-decorated, modern, and hi-tech, with international TV channels.

The Beijing Hotel is in a central location near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, with a subway stop in front of Building A and close proximity to the Wangfujing shopping area. Some reviewers mention that the service can be inconsistent.

The Beijing International Hotel is centrally located near a shopping mall, grocery store, and train station, with easy access to taxis and the subway. It offers a breakfast buffet with both Western and Chinese options and has a currency exchange service in the lobby.

Jade Youth Hostel offers affordable rooms in a central location near the Forbidden City. They provide amenities like Wi-Fi, tour booking, and a helpful staff, making it easy for travelers to explore Beijing.

Sihe Hotel is located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood, offering a quiet and peaceful atmosphere with a beautiful courtyard garden. It is conveniently located near the metro and within walking distance of tourist areas.

The Radegast Beijing is described as a modern, luxurious Chinese 5-star hotel with spacious, well-appointed rooms, multiple restaurants, a spa with a swimming pool, and helpful staff, though some reviews mention potential language barriers and overly attentive service. The hotel is located in the Central Business District, within walking distance of shopping centers and a subway station, but taxi drivers may not be familiar with the location.

The Capital Hotel is centrally located near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, with amenities such as a pool, bowling alley, and multiple restaurants, but some guests found the staff unhelpful and the food expensive. While some rooms are modern and well-appointed, others may be outdated or have maintenance issues, and the hotel can be crowded with tour groups.

The China World Hotel is connected to a shopping mall with designer stores, a supermarket, and a subway stop, offering convenient access to various amenities and transportation. It features multiple restaurants, a gym, a pool, and a Horizon Club level with complimentary services.
The City Hotel is centrally located near bars, restaurants, and the subway. Some rooms have multiple single beds, and some reviewers mention encountering staff who do not speak English.

The Commune by the Great Wall offers a unique experience with architect-designed villas spread across a valley, featuring private access to an unrestored section of the Great Wall. The hotel provides transportation between different parts of the property, several dining options, and spa facilities, but some reviewers noted varying service quality and language barriers with staff.

Courtyard 7 is located in a series of renovated courtyards in the old part of Beijing, in a hutong area full of interesting shops, bars, and restaurants. The hotel is near Nanluoguxiang street, and some rooms have their own private courtyards.
The hotel is conveniently located near a subway station, shopping mall, and various restaurants. It offers clean rooms, helpful staff, and amenities such as a pool and gym.

The hotel has English-speaking staff, and the concierge is helpful with booking tickets and taxis. The hotel is located between the city center and the airport, with a shopping center and restaurants nearby.

The Crowne Plaza Beijing is centrally located on Wangfujing Street, near shopping, dining, and tourist attractions like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Concierge services, helpful staff, and easy access to taxis make it convenient for exploring the city.
The hotel has a pool, spa with steam and sauna, and a variety of restaurants. The Club Lounge is convenient, and the staff are friendly and helpful, with some offering personalized service.

The hotel is located near the airport and exhibition center, but far from the city center and tourist attractions. Some reviewers noted slow service, language barriers with staff, and potential issues with the airport shuttle.

The Crowne Plaza Wuzhou is a comfortable, impersonal business hotel with spacious rooms. It has a small mall with a supermarket and food court next door, and is within walking distance of the Olympic park.
The hotel is near a subway station, but taxi drivers often have difficulty finding it. The hotel is surrounded by construction and is not close to the city center.

Days Inn Forbidden City Beijing is in a great location, near major attractions like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, as well as shopping and subway stations. Many rooms are small, but the staff are helpful in arranging tours and providing directions.
The Days Inn Joiest Beijing is a relatively new hotel with modern, clean rooms that include amenities like flat-screen TVs. It offers a buffet breakfast with a wide variety of options.

Double Happiness Courtyard Hotel is a traditional Chinese house in the middle of old Beijing, located in a hutong (alley neighborhood) with a charming courtyard, Chinese-style decorated rooms, and a quiet, relaxing setting. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the hotel offers amenities such as free internet, breakfast, and a bar.

The Doubletree Hilton Beijing has friendly and helpful staff who can assist with travel tips and transportation arrangements. The hotel has a concierge team, restaurants, a rooftop garden with a swimming pool, and a gym.

Empark Grand Hotel has a Vegas-like mall in the basement (floor B2) with restaurants, boutiques, spas, and a gym/pool. There is also a Golden Resources Cafeteria in the hotel that offers buffet breakfast and dinner.

The Fujian Hotel offers free WIFI, complimentary bottled water, and a breakfast buffet with both Chinese and Western options. Staff are friendly and make an effort to communicate in English, though communication can be a challenge.
The hotel is located within walking distance to the Beijing railway station and an underground station. It is a large hotel aimed mainly at large groups who travel across China.
The Grand Hotel is centrally located near the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, with many attractions within walking distance. It offers spacious rooms, a pool, and an extensive breakfast buffet.

The Grand Hyatt Beijing is connected to the Oriental Plaza shopping mall, has many restaurants, and is within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. The hotel has a large indoor pool and offers various amenities and services, such as arranging tours, currency exchange, and English-speaking staff.

Grand Mercure Hotel Xidan Beijing is centrally located near shopping areas and subway stations, with comfortable rooms and amenities like a pool, gym, and breakfast buffet. The staff is generally helpful, though English proficiency varies, and some reviewers noted the hotel may need some renovations.

The Grand Millennium Hotel in Beijing offers spacious and luxurious rooms with modern decor, free internet, and large bathrooms. It is located in the Central Business District, near a subway station, providing convenient access to various parts of the city.

The hotel has a traditional Chinese architectural style with a garden at the rear and multiple restaurants, a bar, and shops within the premises. Some reviewers mention the hotel is a bit remote from attractions and the city center.

The Guangzhou Hotel is centrally located near the subway, Tiananmen Square, and shopping areas, but some staff have limited English. The hotel offers buffet breakfasts and is situated in a busy area with shops nearby.

The Harmony Hotel is conveniently located near the Beijing Railway Station and subway, making it easy to access various parts of the city. It offers clean rooms and is surrounded by local shops, restaurants, and convenience stores, providing easy access to necessities and dining options.

The Hebei Hotel is a basic courtyard hotel located in a traditional hutong neighborhood, within walking distance of attractions like the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. Some rooms are small and may have issues like smelly drains or plaster falling from the walls, while courtyard suites are larger and better equipped.

The Hilton Beijing has attentive staff, concierge services, and provides cards in English and Chinese to give to taxi drivers for easy returns. It has a gym, pool, several restaurants, and an executive lounge.

The Hilton Beijing Wangfujing is centrally located near shopping and tourist attractions like Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. The hotel is modern with spacious rooms, multiple restaurants, and a pool.

The Holiday Inn Lido is near the airport and part of the Lido complex which includes shops, restaurants, a bowling alley, and a pub. Reviews mention a range of amenities and services, as well as varied dining options including Western and Asian cuisine.

The Holiday Inn Central Plaza is praised for its excellent and helpful staff, including concierge Storm, who can help with travel plans and recommendations; some reviewers noted that the hotel is not centrally located, but taxis are readily available. The hotel also offers a local cell phone, maps, and restaurant recommendations.
The hotel is located on the west side of Beijing, a little far from downtown areas, but close to a subway station. There are restaurants and shops around it, and the staff is friendly.
Holiday Inn Downtown Beijing is located close to a subway station, with restaurants and a supermarket nearby. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet, tour desk, and helpful staff.

The hotel is located near the Olympic Park and a subway station, making it easy to get around, and taxis are readily available. It offers amenities like a laundry room, free internet, and breakfast, and is surrounded by local restaurants and a Chinatown shopping center.

Holiday Inn Express Temple of Heaven is a clean and modern hotel with free Wi-Fi, internet terminals, and breakfast included. Although located in a quiet residential area a bit outside the city center, taxis are readily available and inexpensive for accessing various attractions.

The Holiday Inn Express Wangjing is a new hotel located next to the Hua Tang Shopping Center; free internet is available in the rooms and public areas. It is close to the airport, but taxi drivers may have difficulty finding it.

The Holiday Inn Temple of Heaven is located in a residential area with a nearby supermarket and restaurants, about a 10-minute walk to the nearest subway station and a 15-minute walk to the Temple of Heaven. The hotel has multiple English channels, a health club, and a breakfast buffet with Western and Chinese options.
The hotel has limited English-speaking staff, and some guests have reported attempted overcharging upon checkout and construction noise. Breakfast is included but offers the same choices daily.

Hotel Cote Cour SL is located in a quiet hutong in the center of Beijing, offering a unique experience away from the busy streets. The staff is helpful in providing restaurant recommendations, directions, and arranging transportation.

Hotel G is a trendy and modern boutique hotel located near nightlife and restaurants, with spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and a bar. The hotel provides excellent and friendly service, with staff often going out of their way to assist guests.

Ibis Sanyuan Hotel is located near the Sanyuanqiao subway station, which is also the ABC (airport beijing city) station, providing easy access from the airport and throughout Beijing. The hotel is situated in Phoenix City, an up-and-coming area, and is next to a Novotel, with a Western grocery store within walking distance.
The Kunlun Hotel has multiple restaurants and bars, and some reviewers mention the staff is very good. Some reviewers have noted ongoing renovations, but that the hotel is generally clean.

The New Otani Chang Fu Gong Hotel is centrally located with easy access to subway lines and nearby attractions like the Silk Market. It offers a complimentary breakfast buffet with both Asian and Western options, along with amenities like a health club, pool, and spa.

The Howard Johnson Paragon is conveniently located near the Beijing Railway Station and a subway exit, providing easy access to transportation and a shopping mall. While some guests experienced service issues and varying room conditions, others found the hotel clean and comfortable, with a good breakfast selection.

The Huadu Hotel offers good value with clean, spacious rooms, free internet, and a plentiful breakfast buffet catering to different nationalities; it's conveniently located near the airport, exhibition centers, markets, and restaurants. While not the most modern, the hotel provides a comfortable stay with attentive staff, though English proficiency may vary.

HWA Apartment Hotel is a budget-friendly option located in a lively shopping district with easy access to transportation and a variety of restaurants. The hotel offers apartment-style rooms with kitchens and essential amenities, suitable for travelers seeking a convenient and independent stay.

The Intercontinental Beijing Beichen is located near the Olympic Green, offering views of the Bird's Nest and Water Cube. Some reviewers mention helpful concierge services, excellent staff, and a comfortable atmosphere.

The Intercontinental Beijing is a modern, upscale hotel with spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and large bathrooms. It is located in the financial district, a short taxi ride away from the Forbidden City and other attractions, and has a subway station within walking distance.

The Jade Garden Hotel/Cui Ming Zhuang is in an excellent location within walking distance of the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, Wangfujing shopping strip and night market. The staff are friendly and helpful, and can provide tourist maps with Chinese/English directions.

The hotel is centrally located near a subway station and the Silk Market, with many restaurants and shops nearby. The hotel features a garden, pool, and several restaurants, including French and Chinese options.

The Qianmen Hotel features a theater with Beijing Opera performances, multiple restaurants, and is located near a supermarket, with taxis readily available for accessing attractions like Tiananmen Square. Reviews mention the hotel caters to tour groups and has trainee staff.

Jinqiao Hotel Apartments offers apartment-style rooms with amenities like kitchens, washing machines, and free internet, as well as on-site conveniences like a supermarket, restaurants, and a currency exchange service. The hotel is located near a ring road with easy access to taxis, making it convenient to reach attractions like the Forbidden City and the Great Wall.

Joy City Hotel Beijing is connected to the Joy City shopping mall via walkways on the ground and 6th floors, offering convenient access to shops and restaurants. It is also located near a subway station and airport bus stop.

The JW Marriott Beijing is a new, modern hotel with luxurious and comfortable rooms, a great gym, and a pool area. It's located in a business district next to an upscale shopping mall and close to the subway, with easy access to restaurants and shops.

Hotel Kapok is in a great central location, within walking distance of the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and Wangfujing shopping area, and near many local eateries; taxis are readily available, though some drivers may not know the hotel's location. Rooms feature modern design, with options like courtyard access, free internet, and glass-walled bathrooms (with curtains for privacy).

Kelly's Courtyard is located in a hutong area, a short walk to the main street with buses and taxis, and offers a rooftop terrace for relaxing. The staff is helpful with directions and suggesting transportation options to sights.

The hotel is connected to the Lufthansa Shopping Centre, which includes a supermarket, restaurants, and various service businesses. Multiple restaurants are located within the hotel, including German, Italian, and Chinese options.

The Kuntai Royal Hotel is conveniently located near shopping, restaurants, and transportation, with helpful staff and a plentiful breakfast buffet. Rooms feature comfortable beds and large bathrooms, with amenities like free internet.

Lee Gardens Service Apartment Beijing offers spacious apartments with kitchenettes and is located near shopping areas and attractions like the Forbidden City. Some reviewers mention helpful staff who can assist with directions.

The Legendale Hotel in Beijing features spacious, fully-equipped rooms, an antique-style pool, and a health club with jacuzzies, steam bath, and sauna. It is located near a shopping center, dining options, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.

Loong Palace is a large hotel and resort with recreational facilities such as indoor tennis courts, a bowling alley, a recreation center/gymnasium, a pool, and a spa. It is located outside of the city center, about a 30-minute drive to downtown Beijing and close to the Great Wall and Ming Tombs.

The Luxury Serviced Residence offers spacious apartments with kitchen facilities, and is located near a 24-hour 7-Eleven. It is situated in the embassy area, a short taxi ride away from main tourist spots and about 15 minutes walk from the YongAnLi subway station.
The Marco Polo Parkside Hotel is near the Olympic Park, a bit remote from the city center but accessible by taxi or subway. Several reviewers noted the spacious, clean, and comfortable rooms.

The Marriott West Beijing features large rooms and suites, with staff that are generally helpful and speak English. It is located on the west side of the city, a taxi ride away from major attractions and the city center.

The Marriott is a new hotel with spacious 2-bedroom apartments featuring fully equipped kitchens, multiple TVs, and comfortable living spaces. It offers amenities like a gym, swimming pool, hot tub, sauna, and steam room, with breakfast included.
The Marriott City Wall is close to subway lines and the Beijing Railway station, making it easy to explore the city. The hotel has a variety of restaurants, a pool, and a spa.

The Mercure Wanshang is located away from the noise of Beijing streets, near ring five and a short walk from a subway station that provides access to the Forbidden City in about 30 minutes. The hotel has a gym, pool, business lounge, and multiple restaurants.

Michael's House is a small, family-run hotel with a friendly and welcoming atmosphere, offering a mix of Western and Asian breakfast. The staff is helpful in providing directions and arranging tours, making it easy to explore Beijing without a strict plan.

This hotel is located in the Wangfujing area, near shopping, food markets, and public transportation like the subway. It offers rooms at different price points, with some being small and without windows, while others are larger and cleaner.

The hotel is located in the Chaoyang District, near the Chaoyang theater, with easy subway access to the Silk Market and Tiananmen Square. It features modern rooms with LCD TVs, and a breakfast buffet suited for foreigners.

The hotel is located in Beijing's west end, not centrally located but with reasonable taxi transportation, and across from a Carrefour store for supplies. Some reviewers found the staff helpful and the breakfast buffet comprehensive with Western, Japanese, and Chinese choices.

The Novotel Peace Beijing is in a great location near shopping, the Forbidden City, and the night market and many reviewers found the location allowed them to go with the flow. The hotel has a large lobby with free wifi and comfortable rooms and guests found the breakfast buffet was also very good.

The Novotel Xin Qiao is located next to the Chongwenmen subway station, making it easy to get around the city. The hotel is near shopping centers, local restaurants, and attractions like Tiananmen Square.

Oakwood Residence Beijing offers spacious, fully-equipped apartments with kitchens, laundry machines, and comfortable amenities. The staff is generally helpful and the location provides easy access to the city.

The Orange Hotel is conveniently located near the subway and offers easy access to taxis, making it simple to explore the city, and is within walking distance of the Olympic stadium and a large supermarket. The hotel provides complimentary pastries, milk, and tea, and is near restaurants and a bakery.

The Oriental Bay International Hotel has multiple restaurants including a 24-hour option with both Western and local food, and is located near a metro station for easy access to Beijing central. Staff are generally helpful, and the hotel includes amenities such as a pool, gym, and breakfast buffet with both Asian and Western choices.

The Beijing Oriental Culture Hotel is centrally located near a subway station, restaurants, and a supermarket. It offers amenities such as a pool, gym, and breakfast buffet with both Chinese and Western options.

The Oriental Garden Hotel offers spacious and clean rooms, with a mix of Asian and Western dishes available through 24-hour room service and a breakfast buffet; the hotel is located a short taxi ride from Tian'anmen Square and the Forbidden City. While some staff have limited English, the front desk is often English-speaking and helpful.

The Marriott Palm Springs Executive Apartments in Beijing offers spacious apartments with kitchens and laundry facilities, a pool, and a gym. It is located in a secure, gated complex with easy taxi access to Sanlitun, CBD, and the airport, though some taxi drivers may have difficulty finding it.

The Park Hyatt Beijing features modern, spacious rooms with amenities like heated floors, Japanese-style toilets, and Nespresso machines, but requires navigating multiple elevators to reach rooms and facilities. Some reviewers noted that taxi drivers may have difficulty locating the hotel entrance.

The Park Plaza Beijing Wangfujing is centrally located near the Dengshikou subway stop, shopping, and restaurants, with staff offering helpful advice and directions. It is easy to get around from this hotel, with taxis readily available, and the concierge can assist in arranging tours.
The hotel has free in-room internet, and is located a 10-15 minute taxi ride from the city center and major sites. Some staff have limited English, but are willing to help.

The Plaza Hotel is located on one of Beijing's ring roads and is near a KFC, with a restaurant opposite the hotel across the ring road. It is also located about fifteen minutes by foot to an area with hutongs and a local market.

The Prime Hotel is located at the quiet end of Wangfujing, Beijing's modern shopping area and within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. The hotel is near plenty of shops and restaurants and close to a metro station.
The hotel is near a metro station on line 1, providing easy access to the city center, and taxis are readily available. It is also located next to Wanda Plaza, a shopping mall with restaurants.
The hotel is located on a street full of restaurants and is a 5-15 minute walk to nearby subway stations. Breakfast is a buffet with both Western and Chinese options.
Raffles Beijing is in a central location near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, with a subway station nearby. Some rooms have views of construction, and the hotel can be busy with tourists.

The Renaissance Capital Hotel is a modern hotel near a subway station and a shopping mall, with a friendly and attentive staff known for excellent service. The hotel offers a concierge service, contemporary rooms with comfortable beds, and a fitness center.

The hotel is located in a quieter part of Beijing, away from the busy Tiananmen Square, with easy access to cabs for transportation. Even if a cab drops you off at the wrong location, you might discover a place you like by mistake.
The Shangri-La Beijing is a large hotel with multiple restaurants, a gym, and a spa. It is located away from the city center, but taxis are readily available.

The Kerry Centre is a modern, luxurious hotel with many amenities, including a gym, pool, and 24-hour bar. It is located in the CBD, near the China World Hotel and embassies, and connected to a mall with conveniences like dry cleaning and a convenience store.

The Shatan Hotel is located on a small, lively street near the Forbidden City, offering an authentic Beijing experience with local shops and restaurants. It is described as a good value with clean rooms and helpful staff, though some taxi drivers may have difficulty finding it.

The Sofitel Wanda Beijing is a modern and luxurious hotel with spacious rooms, a large indoor pool, and multiple restaurants and bars. It is located in the CBD/Financial area, close to shopping centers, a cinema, and a Wal-Mart, with easy access to taxis and the subway.

The hotel is located near the Guloudaije subway stop on Line 2, in an old neighborhood with narrow streets. It is close to the drum and bell tower, and a 10-15 minute walk from the lakes and bar street.

Somerset ZhongGuanCun offers serviced apartments with amenities like a daily breakfast lounge, pool, and gym. It is located within walking distance of a supermarket and a subway line, though some cab drivers have difficulty finding it.

The Spring Garden Courtyard Hotel is located in a hutong and has traditional Chinese-style rooms with classic furniture surrounding a courtyard. The staff is helpful and can assist with arranging tours and transportation.

The Sunworld Hotel (formerly Tianlun Songhe Hotel) is centrally located near Wangfujing Street, with easy access to shopping, restaurants, and tourist attractions like the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. Taxis are readily available, and the hotel provides cards with destinations written in Chinese to facilitate transportation.
The Swissotel Beijing is conveniently located next to a subway station and offers easy access to taxis, making it easy to get around the city. The hotel features a bar called "The Flow".

Templeside Deluxe Hutong House is located in a traditional Beijing neighborhood (hutong), offering an authentic experience of local life, and the owner speaks excellent English and is very helpful. The hotel features a central courtyard covered with a glass roof, creating a cozy lobby/living room area.

The Aman at Summer Palace is located on the grounds of the Summer Palace, offering a serene atmosphere and private access to the historical site. Guests have described the hotel as feeling like a home away from home, with spacious suites, courtyards, and access to amenities like a spa, library, and private cinema.

The Emperor Hotel is a modern, boutique hotel with unique design elements, including rooms named after Chinese Emperors, and is located near the Forbidden City. It offers amenities like a free minibar, free wireless internet, and a rooftop bar with city views.

The Opposite House has flexible check-in/out times and a staff known for providing excellent and personalized service, making guests feel at ease. The hotel's design is unique and relaxed, resembling a private residence, and is located in the Sanlitun Village shopping area.

The Peninsula Beijing offers impeccable service, helpful staff and is conveniently located near shopping and tourist destinations. It has comfortable rooms, state-of-the-art technology, and a good selection of dining options, making for a relaxed and easy stay.

The Regent Beijing offers a luxurious and convenient stay with a central location near shopping and tourist attractions, as well as easy access to the subway. Many reviewers mention smooth check-in, helpful concierge services, and comfortable rooms, creating a relaxing and enjoyable experience.

The Ritz-Carlton Beijing Financial Street offers a relaxing atmosphere, a spa, and a pool, and is located in a quieter business district, away from the city's congestion. It is connected to a shopping mall and has several restaurants, although some taxi drivers may not be familiar with its location.
The Ritz-Carlton Beijing is next to a shopping mall and close to the Dawanglu subway stop, making it easy to get around the city. The hotel has a spa, pool, and gym.

The St. Regis Beijing offers a relaxing atmosphere with luxurious amenities like a large pool, spa, bowling alley, and multiple restaurants. Many reviewers highlight the excellent and attentive service provided by the staff and butlers.

The Westin Beijing Chaoyang offers luxurious, modern rooms with automated window blinds, comfortable beds, and rainforest showers. The hotel has a large indoor pool, state-of-the-art fitness center, and is conveniently located next to a subway station for easy access to the city.

The Westin Beijing Financial Street is a modern hotel with a focus on business travelers, offering comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast and dinner buffets, and a comprehensive fitness center. Although it is not located near the main tourist sites, taxis are readily available and inexpensive.

The Tianlun Dynasty Hotel is centrally located on Wangfujing Street, within walking distance of many attractions and shopping areas. It features a large inner atrium with live music and dining, offering a relaxing environment.

Tian Rui Hotel is located on a quiet hutong near Wangfujing Street and a subway station, offering a convenient location with access to shopping, dining, and transportation. The hotel features English-speaking staff, a restaurant, and amenities like internet access, spacious rooms, and western-friendly services.

The Tiantan Hotel is near the Temple of Heaven and Pearl Market, with a breakfast buffet that offers both Eastern and Western options. The surrounding area is quiet, requiring a cab to reach restaurants, and some reviewers noted that the staff's English proficiency is limited.

Traders Hotel is located in the World Trade Center complex with access to offices, shops and the subway. The hotel is near shopping areas like Silk Street, and offers amenities such as a gym, spa, and breakfast buffet.

The Traders Upper East hotel caters to business travelers with a gym open until 11pm, and is located halfway between the airport and city center. The hotel provides services such as airport pickup, and assistance with arranging transportation.

The Wangfujing Grand Hotel is centrally located near the Forbidden City and Wangfujing shopping street. Some reviewers mention the hotel has many amenities such as a restaurant, tea house, nightclub, shops, lounge, spa, and travel office.
The hotel has multiple buildings with restaurants, cafes and other services. It is located near universities, with convenient access to the subway, but is not in a central location.

The hotel has a swimming pool, spa, bowling alley, table tennis, gym, and rec room. It is located within a 15-minute walk of the Forbidden City and Wangfujing shopping street, and has taxis readily available.

Xinyuan Inn is located in a modern, touristy hutong with a grocery store nearby, offering an authentic Chinese experience. It provides breakfast, though a 7-11 and traditional Chinese breakfast restaurant are also close, and is within walking distance of sights and bus access.

The XiXI Youyi Hotel is located near the Xidan shopping area and subway station, with multiple restaurants in the building and a currency exchange office. The hotel offers spacious rooms and buffet breakfasts, and is within easy access to supermarkets and taxi services.

The Xiyuan Hotel is located near the zoo and has a Carrefour supermarket, Pizza Hut, and Pizza Factory within walking distance. The hotel has multiple restaurants including a revolving restaurant with international buffet and a grill room and offers a breakfast buffet.

The hotel is located in the Haidan University District, a 5-minute taxi or 7-8 minute bus ride to the XiZhiMen underground station, and near a supermarket and market. The surrounding local restaurants cater to students and have picture menus.

The Zhong An Hotel is located near the Beijing Railway Station and subway, making it easy to explore the city. Some rooms have computers with free internet, and the staff is helpful in providing directions and booking tours.
